intro: Cliffortia filicaulis var. octandra, commonly known as the octandra chandelier plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers that resemble chandeliers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish-green pods. This species is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
